content:
When opening "more topics" under a stream we get the nice list of topics to search/scroll through. An important part is the Back to streams button at the top:
image.png

but when you scroll down in the topics list, that button is also included in the scrolling and disappears. I've found this kind of unintuitive and found myself stumbling around to figure out where did the button go and how to get back to the normal list of streams until figuring out i need to scroll back up. I think that possibly the scrolling should be just through the topics list and Back to streams (and possibly the stream name + "filter topics" search box) should be an independent element that stays on top?
Hmm, i think this belongs in #design actually, let me move it.
This topic was moved here from #issues > "more topics" scrolling by Mateusz Mandera.
Mmm, yeah, it would probably make sense for that to be sticky. Maybe even more of the top area, including the stream name and topic filter?
Yeah, I think all of those heading elements should be outside the scroll area.
I filed Make top elements sticky in "more topics" view #22911.
I just tested in development environment. I think Back to streams button is working as expected. cam.webm
@Akarsh Jain I'm not sure I understand the question, but you'll likely need to have enough topics that a scrollbar is present in the "more topics" view in order to reproduce/fix this issue.
